title: Fatal fire, damning video put harsh focus on Mexico’s migrant centers
description: Catholic Church leaders, human-rights groups, the opposition party and even government allies are demanding an end to abuses within the facilities.

title: Deal ‘evolving’ to protect Ukrainian nuclear plant at risk of catastrophe
description: Proposals for the safety of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant, Europe’s largest, are "a work in progress," IAEA head Rafael Mariano Grossi said during a visit to the site.

title: EU slams prison term for Russian father in antiwar art case
description: Russia’s prosecution of a single father whose daughter drew an antiwar sketch at school elicited outrage from the European Union, even as the man, who fled house arrest before the verdict was announced, remained at large

title: Kyiv monks accused of Russia links refuse eviction order
description: Orthodox monks who’ve been ordered out of a monastery in Kyiv have refused to leave as a deadline to vacate the complex expired

title: UAE leader designates his eldest son as crown prince
description: Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, the president of the United Arab Emirates, has appointed his eldest son Khaled as crown prince of Abu Dhabi

title: Amsterdam warns hard-partying Brits to ‘Stay Away’ from street drugs
description: A couple of PSAs targeted at young Brits warn visitors to Amsterdam that excessive partying could send you to the hospital — or jail.

title: Pope Francis hospitalized with respiratory infection, Vatican says
description: Pope Francis is seeking treatment for a respiratory infection. The Vatican said he would spend "a few days" at the Gemelli hospital in Rome.

title: Storm kills 4 people, injures several in war-torn Syria
description: A pro-government radio station says a storm in central Syria collapsed building walls in two villages, killing four people, including two children

title: Mexico probes 4 marines found protecting Russian migrants
description: Mexico’s Navy says it has placed four marines under investigation after they were allegedly found providing protection for a group of undocumented Russian migrants

title: Mexico: Despite "coup," Castillo legal president of Peru
description: Mexico’s president says Pedro Castillo remains “the legal and legitimate president” of Peru and that he was jailed as part of a “coup.”

title: Mexico's president says country is safe to travel anywhere
description: Mexico’s president claims every corner of his country is safe enough to travel to, despite persistently high murder rates and areas plagued by drug gang turf wars

title: Founding member of pope's child protection board resigns
description: A founding member of Pope Francis’ child protection advisory board has resigned

title: Biden-Netanyahu spat bursts into full view
description: A growing rift between President Biden and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu burst into the open as the two leaders exchanged barbs.

title: Prince Harry blames royal family for delay in hacking suit
description: Prince Harry has blamed the royal family for a delay in bringing his phone hacking lawsuit against the publisher of The Daily Mail

title: Russia puts Pussy Riot member on wanted list for criminals
description: Russian authorities have put a member of the Pussy Riot punk group on a wanted list of criminal suspects as the Kremlin works to stifle political dissent

title: Danes say object beside Nord Stream pipeline a harmless buoy
description: A mysterious object found at the bottom of the Baltic Sea, which Danish authorities had hoped could provide clues to the bombings that incapacitated the Nord Stream pipelines, has turned out to be a harmless smoke signal canister

title: Vatican: Pope Francis goes to hospital for scheduled tests
description: The Vatican says Pope Francis has gone to a Rome hospital for some scheduled tests

title: Adidas gives up attempt to block Black Lives Matter trademark
description: Adidas had filed an opposition to a Black Lives Matter Global Network Foundation logo, which had three yellow stripes, saying was "confusingly similar" to its own logo.

title: Militants kill 9 soldiers in attack on Colombia's military
description: Authorities say militants in Colombia killed at least nine soldiers and injured another nine in an attack early Wednesday on a military post in a troubled region near the country’s border with Venezuela

title: Man charged over Danish mall shooting that killed 3
description: Danish police say a 23-year-old man has formally been charged with murder and attempted murder for allegedly opening fire last year in a crowded Copenhagen shopping mall

title: Greece: Terror suspects offered money to target Jewish site
description: Greek authorities say police are continuing searches in Athens and other parts of the country following the arrest of two suspects accused of planning an attack at Jewish center in a busy downtown area of the Greek capital

title: Portugal: Muslim center stabbings not seen as terror attack
description: Authorities in Portugal say the fatal stabbings of two women at an Ismaili Muslim center in Lisbon are not being treated as a potential act of terrorism

title: Sweden finds woman guilty of war crimes for gruesome photos
description: A Swedish court has found 35-year-old woman guilty of war crimes for posting photos of herself with severed heads that were on display in a Syrian city in 2014

title: South Africa manhunt for convicted killer who escaped prison
description: South African police have launched a manhunt for convicted rapist and murderer Thabo Bester who escaped from a privately-run maximum security prison in the Free State province under bizarre circumstances

title: Letters with powdered substance sent to Sweden's counties
description: Several county boards in Sweden have received letters containing a powdered substance Wednesday, leading to the evacuation of employees in some places

title: U.S. says Taiwan president is just passing through. China’s not amused.
description: Tsai Ing-wen's trip to the United States, where she is set to meet House Speaker Kevin McCarthy, could escalate into a dangerous crisis, analysts warn.

title: Police: Man who jumped to death in UAE killed wife, 2 kids
description: Police say a man in the United Arab Emirates’ sheikhdom of Sharjah jumped off a balcony to his death after killing his wife and two children

title: Germany's high court orders amendment of child marriage ban
description: Germany’s constitutional court ruled Wednesday that a law banning child marriages needs to be amended because it removes the possibility of continuing a marriage once both spouses become adults

title: Sweden summons Russian envoy over 'retaliation' remark
description: Sweden’s Foreign ministry has summoned the Russian ambassador after Moscow’s diplomatic mission to Stockholm posted on its website that the Scandinavian country would become a “legitimate target for Russia’s retaliatory measures” if it joins NATO

title: Swiss seniors take government to European court over climate
description: Swiss pensioners are taking their government to a top European court over what they claim is its failure to take stronger action on climate change

title: British comedian and TV star Paul O'Grady dies at 67
description: Entertainer Paul O’Grady, who achieved fame as drag queen Lily Savage before becoming a much-loved comedian and host on British television, has died

title: Some in dry Somalia break Ramadan fast with little but water
description: This year’s holy month of Ramadan coincides with the longest drought on record in Somalia

title: Assad reshuffles Syria's Cabinet amid harsh economic crisis
description: Syrian state media reports that President Bashar Assad has replaced several Cabinet ministers amid a sharp increase in prices and worsening economic conditions during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan

title: Calls mount for Taliban to free girls' education activist
description: A top US diplomat says the Taliban must free detained Afghanistan activists, following the arrest of a girls’ education advocate

title: Israeli PM, Biden exchange frosty words over legal overhaul
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says Israel makes its own decisions, rebuffing President Joe Biden’s suggestion that that the premier drop a contentious plan to overhaul the legal system

title: Who still recognizes Taiwan? What to know about Honduras’s shift to Beijing.
description: Taiwan is now left with only 13 diplomatic allies as Beijing mounts a pressure campaign to isolate the island democracy.

title: Mark Hamill, as Luke Skywalker, voices air raid alerts in Ukraine
description: Hamill is one of many celebrities to contribute to humanitarian efforts in Ukraine and was recruited to raise money for military drones last year.

title: He came to D.C. as a Brazilian student. The U.S. says he was a Russian spy.
description: A former graduate student in Washington, who claimed to be Brazilian but was unmasked as a Russian spy, has been charged by the U.S. with acting as a foreign agent.

title: Palestinian teachers' strike grows, reflecting deep crisis
description: It’s the middle of the semester, yet a million kids across the Israeli-occupied West Bank are out of school

title: Why sea creatures are washing up dead around the world
description: From Florida to New Zealand, algal blooms, warming seas and human activities are threatening aquatic species.

title: 38 dead in Mexico fire after guards didn't let migrants out
description: When smoke began billowing out of a migrant detention center in the Mexican border city of Ciudad Juarez, Venezuelan migrant Viangly Infante Padrón was terrified because she knew her husband was still inside

title: Ukraine live briefing: Blinken warns cease-fire calls may be a ‘cynical trap’
description: The U.S. secretary of state said calls from some nations to stop the fighting could be a ploy allowing Russia to consolidate territory it has illegally seized.

title: Biden’s Summit for Democracy is a tough hill to climb
description: Some U.S. officials and foreign policy experts see President Biden's Summit for Democracy as an inconsequential talk shop.
